page.title: 04Housing continued.
page.content: The residents have formed the 'Hardown Society'. This integrates the people socially, offering a programme of guided walks and also protecting the natural setting in which it's members live. Worthy of mention is a group of eight semi_detached council owned houses with large well tended gardens on the steep sloping Southern side of the A.35 road These houses surely must have one of the most attractive views in the area with an uninterrupted vista of the coastal hills with the sea beyond. The old village settlement of Morcombelake is to be found on the South Western slopes of Hardown Hill just off the narrow winding road to Ryall.A huddle of attractively updated homes with many still showing evidence of their cottage beginings can be seen
